summary:

title: NASA Moon Mission Spacesuit Nears Milestone
summary: The next-generation spacesuit for NASA’s Artemis III mission continues to advance by passing a contractor-led technical review, as the agency prepares to send humans to the Moon’s South Pole for the first time. Testing is also underway for the new suits, built by Axiom Space, with NASA astronauts and spacesuit engineers recently simulating surface operations and tasks […]

title: Liftoff power: launch of first Ariane 6 with four boosters
summary: At 16:45 GMT/17:45 CET the first Ariane 6 rocket with four boosters lifted off from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana on 12 February, taking 32 Amazon Leo satellites to orbit.

title: USSF-87 Anomaly Reveals Continuing Obstacles for ULA’s Vulcan-Centaur
summary: A familiar anomaly encountered during Vulcan's launch of USSF-87 raises significant concerns for the vehicle’s immediate future.

title: Shimmering Light in Egg Nebula
summary: This image from NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope released on Feb. 10, 2026, reveals a dramatic interplay of light and shadow in the Egg Nebula, sculpted by freshly ejected stardust. Located approximately 1,000 light-years away in the constellation Cygnus, the Egg Nebula features a central star obscured by a dense cloud of dust — like a “yolk” nestled […]

title: NASA loading liquid hydrogen aboard Artemis 2 rocket in unannounced test
summary: NASA is loading liquid hydrogen aboard its Space Launch System moon rocket at the Kennedy Space Center on Thursday for an unpublicized but crucial test of the repairs made to a leaky umbilical that derailed a countdown rehearsal on Feb. 2.

title: It is time to take astronomy off Earth

authors.name: Fredrick Jenet, Teviet Creighton, Hoyt Davidson, Grant Hendrickson, Alma Miller, Volker Quetschke, Dale Skran and Paul Wunderl

summary:
Astronomy and commercial space are often portrayed as being on a collision course, yet their futures are deeply intertwined. As satellite constellations expand, astronomers raise concerns about trails across images, interference with radio telescopes and the loss of dark skies. At the same time, commercial operators point to the enormous economic, scientific and national security […]

title: Eutelsat to Take Out Almost €1B in State-Backed Debt for New Satellites
summary:
European satellite communications operator Eutelsat is set to receive almost €1 billion in French government-backed financing to expand its OneWeb broadband constellation. In a June 2025 Investor Presentation, Eutelsat stated that it had already ordered 100 satellites from Airbus Defence and Space in December 2024 to ensure continuity of its current OneWeb service. The presentation […]

title: Launch companies debate how to compete against SpaceX
summary:
Launch companies are divided on how to compete with SpaceX in a market where demand outstrips supply, yet customers remain price sensitive.
